snippet: Just as the three-month N.H.L. lockout appeared to be headed to a conclusion, the league rejected the players union’s latest proposal.
abstract: NHL deputy commissioner Bill Daly rejects most recent, and potentially most-promising offer yet by players' union just as executive director Donald Fehr expressed optimism that three-month lockout was near end.
lead_paragraph: Just as the three-month N.H.L. lockout appeared to be headed to a conclusion, the league rejected the players union’s latest proposal.

headline.seo: N.H.L. Back at Stalemate After Near-Deal
headline.main: Stalemate and Rancor Stage Rally in N.H.L.
headline.print_headline: Stalemate And Rancor Stage Rally In N.H.L.
